name: Lavish Singhal
about: Currently working as a Risk Analyst for the Citi U.S. Branded Cards portfolio. Majored in biotechnology and biochemical engineering where I explored diverse fields during my undergrad ranging from synthetic biology to building oxygen concentrator. I also undertook projects related to data science and machine learning, financial modeling, bioethanol production, genetic algorithms, biosensors. I am passionate about solving real-world problems. I look for opportunities to apply theoretical principles in the field and have worked hard to develop a sound understanding in interdisciplinary fields.

experience.title: Content Manager
experience.description: India Biotech Leaders of Tomorrow (IBLoT) is a non-profit initiative aiming to foster a community of biotech leaders of tomorrow and today, to accelerate the growth of the Indian Bioeconomy.We’re building a diverse community of Indian bio-enthusiasts spanning entrepreneurs, scientists, academics, researchers, investors, policymakers, and students to enable collaborations and conversations.

certifications.subtitle: Coursera
certifications.title: Python and Statistics for Financial Analysis

projects: [{"title":"Genome Scale Metabolic Reconstruction and in-silico metabolic analysis","start_date":"Mar 2020","end_date":"May 2020","description":"Preparing Genome-Scale Metabolic Model of Geobacillus LC300 leveraging modelSEED, COBRApy, and COBRA Toolbox v3.0. Draft model obtained from modelSEED with 1210 reactions and 776 genes. Performed Manual curation to rectify reversibility bounds, charge using COBRApy. Computational Techniques learned: RAST Server and modelSEED for Draft reconstruction model, COBRApy, Python for Data Science, COBRA Toolbox v3.0"},{"title":"Deep biosphere Database and Computational analysis of phylogenetic potential","start_date":"Nov 2019","end_date":"Jan 2020","description":"Creating a database for the microbial consortia present in the deep biosphere, approx. 3000m below the earth’s surface. Data mining FASTA files of raw sequences of the 16s rRNA amplicon sequence from the NCBI database with accession numbers obtained from deep biosphere inventory. Mapping genes with respective KO IDs to their molecular functions using KEGG Orthology Database. Mapping genes to their respective metabolic pathways using the KEGG Pathway Database. RNAseq Data Analysis using EXCEL for statistics and edgeR package in Bioconductor package using RStdio."},{"title":"Techno-economic analysis and Scale-up Studies for efficient bio-ethanol production","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"Jul 2019","description":"Developing strategies for optimization of lignin degradation, hydrolysis, and fermentation for ethanol production from lignocellulosic biomass primarily focusing on wheat straw and sugarcane bagasse.Optimization of consolidated bioprocessing for different enzyme cocktails comprising of crude laccase extracted from native fungi strain, cellulase, and hemicellulase, temperature and time conditions followed by fermentation using Saccharomyces cerevisiae.Performed Techno-economic analysis and scale-up analysis to understand the feasibility of scaling up of the technology.Experimental Techniques learned: Spectrophotometry, HPLC, Assaying estimation Protocols, Distillation techniques.Significant achievements and outcomes: Established pilot-scale proof of concept and presentation of results"}]
